attributes.action: honour his promise given in July 2008 to not raise fuel duty for a full year.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In Prime Minister's Questions on 16th July 2008, the Prime Minister made a promise to not raise fuel duty for one whole year.

He has already broken this promise once in December (to counteract the effect of the VAT reduction) - and intends to break it for a second time this April 1st with a 1.84p/litre - being a taxable tax this is 2p/litre after VAT.

Fuel tax is high enough as it is, with a struggling economy it's hardly helping the population and business get on with keeping the economy ticking over.

This petition is NOT calling for a tax redution (though that would be nice) but for the PM to honour his promise of not raising fuel duty for a year.
